info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:26PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lincoln and northwestern Sanders Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 626 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles east of Clark Fork to 17 miles north of Thompson Falls. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Noxon, Tuscor, Heron and Trout Creek. This includes Highway 200 W between mile markers 2 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
